questions.question: Which ancient civilisation first developed trade relations with the countries of the west as mentioned in the chapter?
questions.answer: Harappan civilisation

questions.question: What kind of exchanges did India have with the outside world ever since the Harappan period?
questions.answer: Economic and cultural exchanges

questions.question: To which regions had Buddhism spread from India in the ancient period according to the chapter?

options.text: Afghanistan and many countries of Central Asia

questions.answer: Afghanistan and many countries of Central Asia

questions.question: During which empire did India’s contact with the western world increase significantly?
questions.answer: Iranian empire

questions.question: What led Greek historians to write more about India in ancient times?
questions.answer: Their growing curiosity about India

questions.question: How was India introduced to the western world in ancient times, as described in the chapter?
questions.answer: Through Greek historians’ writings

questions.question: The routes later used by Alexander were originally opened for what purpose?

options.text: Trade between India and the countries of the west

questions.answer: Trade between India and the countries of the west

questions.question: Which foreign artistic tradition influenced the emergence of the Gandhara school of art in India?
questions.answer: Greek art of sculpture

questions.answer: Kushana period

questions.question: What was mainly carved in the Gandhara school of art?
questions.answer: Images of Gautam Buddha

questions.question: Why is the style called the ‘Gandhara style’ in Indian art history?

options.text: Because the artists belonged to Gandhara guilds
Because most images were found in the Gandhara region of Afghanistan
Because it was patronised by a king named Gandhara
Because it originated in South India

options.text: They resemble Sri Lankan facial features
They resemble Roman facial features only

questions.answer: They resemble Greek facial features

questions.question: The early coins minted in India were similar to which other coins, as stated in the chapter?
questions.answer: Greek coins

questions.question: During which centuries did trade between India and Rome flourish?
questions.answer: First or second century CE

questions.answer: South India

questions.answer: Rome

questions.question: Kolhapur and Arikamedu were important in ancient times for which reason?

options.text: Centres of trade between India and Rome

questions.answer: Centres of trade between India and Rome

questions.question: Which Roman emperor’s gold coin was found at Arikamedu?
questions.answer: Emperor Augustus

questions.question: Which port in Egypt is mentioned as important for carrying Indian goods to Europe?
questions.answer: Alexandria

questions.question: Which group of merchants carried Indian goods up to Alexandria?
questions.answer: Arab merchants

questions.question: Apart from Indian goods, what else did the Arabs convey from India to Europe?
questions.answer: Indian philosophy and science

questions.question: Which important mathematical concept is mentioned as one of India’s major contributions to the world?
questions.answer: The concept of zero

questions.question: Who introduced the Indian concept of zero to Europe, as mentioned in the chapter?
questions.answer: Arab scholars

questions.question: To which island did King Ashoka send Mahendra and Sanghamitra to spread Buddhism?
questions.answer: Sri Lanka

questions.question: Which text from Sri Lanka mentions Mahendra and Sanghamitra?
questions.answer: Mahavamsa

questions.question: What did Sanghamitra carry with her to Sri Lanka according to the chapter?

options.text: A branch of the Bodhi tree

questions.answer: A branch of the Bodhi tree

questions.question: According to Sri Lankan tradition, where is the Bodhi tree that grew from the branch brought by Sanghamitra located?
questions.answer: Anuradhpur

questions.question: For which Sri Lankan products was there a great demand in India?
questions.answer: Pearls and other precious stones

questions.question: Who had caves dug at Sigiriya in the fifth century CE?
questions.answer: King Kashyap

questions.question: The wall paintings in the Sigiriya caves bear a resemblance to which famous Indian paintings?
questions.answer: Ajanta Caves paintings

questions.question: Which language are the Sri Lankan Buddhist works ‘Dipavamsa’ and ‘Mahavamsa’ written in?
questions.answer: Pali

questions.question: What kind of relations existed between India and China from ancient times, as mentioned in the chapter?
questions.answer: Trade and cultural relations

questions.question: Which Indian emperor sent an ambassador to the Chinese court?
questions.answer: Emperor Harshavardhan

questions.question: What was Chinese silk known as in ancient India?
questions.answer: Chinanshuka

questions.question: What was the land route by which the silk trade between China and western countries was carried on called?
questions.answer: Silk Route

questions.question: Which place near Mumbai in Maharashtra was connected to the Silk Route?
questions.answer: Nala-sopara

questions.question: Which Chinese Buddhist bhikkhus came to India through the Silk Route?
questions.answer: Fa Hien and Yuan Chwang

questions.question: Which Chinese emperor invited Dharmarakshaka and Kashyapmatanga to China in the first century CE?
questions.answer: Ming Emperor

questions.question: What important work did Dharmarakshaka and Kashyapmatanga do in China?

options.text: Translated Indian Buddhist texts into Chinese

questions.answer: Translated Indian Buddhist texts into Chinese

questions.question: The translation of Indian Buddhist texts into Chinese helped mainly in the spread of Buddhism to which country first?
questions.answer: China

questions.question: To which countries did Buddhism spread later from China, as mentioned in the chapter?
questions.answer: Japan, Korea and Vietnam

questions.question: Which ancient kingdom in Cambodia was established in the first century CE?
questions.answer: Funan

questions.question: According to Chinese traditions, who established the ancient kingdom of Funan in Cambodia?
questions.answer: An Indian named Kaundinya

questions.question: The people of Funan are known to have been familiar with which language?
questions.answer: Sanskrit

questions.question: What evidence of Funan’s connection with Indian culture still exists?
questions.answer: A Sanskrit stone inscription

questions.question: What role did the small kingdoms established by people of Indian origin in Southeast Asia play?

options.text: They helped spread Indian culture in Southeast Asia
They stopped the spread of Buddhism

questions.answer: They helped spread Indian culture in Southeast Asia

questions.question: In which country are dance-dramas based on the Ramayana and Mahabharata still popular?
questions.answer: Indonesia

questions.question: To which Southeast Asian countries did Buddhism spread in the ancient period from India?
questions.answer: Myanmar, Thailand and Indonesia

questions.question: Temples dedicated to which deities were built in Southeast Asia in later years?
questions.answer: Shiva and Vishnu

questions.question: What type of relations did the Harappan civilisation establish with western countries?
questions.answer: The Harappan civilisation established trade relations with the countries of the west.

questions.question: State one long-term result of India’s early contact with foreign countries.
questions.answer: India developed continuous economic and cultural exchanges with the outside world.

questions.question: Why did Greek historians become interested in India?
questions.answer: Greek historians grew curious about India due to increased contact during the Iranian empire period.

questions.question: How did Greek writings help the western world?
questions.answer: Greek writings introduced India and its culture to the western world.

questions.question: What was the importance of the routes later used by Alexander?
questions.answer: These routes were originally opened for trade between India and the western countries.

questions.question: Name the period during which the Gandhara school of art emerged.
questions.answer: The Gandhara school of art emerged during the Kushana period.

questions.question: Which foreign artistic tradition influenced the Gandhara school of art?
questions.answer: The Greek art of sculpture influenced the Gandhara school of art.

questions.question: What type of images were mainly created in the Gandhara school of art?
questions.answer: Images of Gautam Buddha were mainly created in the Gandhara school of art.

questions.question: Why are Gandhara sculptures associated with Afghanistan?
questions.answer: Many Gandhara style sculptures were found in the Gandhara region of Afghanistan.

questions.question: Mention one Greek feature visible in Gandhara sculptures.
questions.answer: The facial features of the statues resemble those of Greek people.

questions.question: When did trade between India and Rome flourish?
questions.answer: Trade between India and Rome flourished around the first or second century CE.

questions.question: Which region of India significantly contributed to Indo-Roman trade?
questions.answer: The ports in South India significantly contributed to Indo-Roman trade.

questions.question: What Roman-made objects were found at Kolhapur?
questions.answer: Articles made of bronze manufactured in Rome were found at Kolhapur.

questions.question: Why is Arikamedu considered an important trade centre?
questions.answer: Many articles made in Rome were found at Arikamedu, indicating Indo-Roman trade.

questions.question: What do archaeological excavations reveal about ancient trade?
questions.answer: Excavations reveal the existence of international trade centres and foreign-made goods.

questions.question: Why was Alexandria important in ancient trade?
questions.answer: Alexandria was an important port from where Indian goods were sent to Europe.

questions.question: Who transported Indian goods to Alexandria?
questions.answer: Arab merchants transported Indian goods to Alexandria.

questions.question: Apart from goods, what knowledge did Arabs carry to Europe?
questions.answer: Arabs carried Indian philosophy and science to Europe.

questions.question: Name one major Indian contribution to world knowledge mentioned in the chapter.
questions.answer: The concept of zero is a major Indian contribution to the world.

questions.question: Who introduced the Indian concept of zero to Europe?
questions.answer: The Arabs introduced the Indian concept of zero to Europe.

questions.question: Which Indian ruler sent missionaries to Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: King Ashoka sent missionaries to Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Name the two missionaries sent to Sri Lanka by Ashoka.
questions.answer: Mahendra and Sanghamitra were sent to Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Which Buddhist text records Ashoka’s mission to Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: The Buddhist text Mahavamsa records Ashoka’s mission to Sri Lanka.

questions.question: What sacred object did Sanghamitra take to Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Sanghamitra carried a branch of the Bodhi tree to Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Why is the Bodhi tree at Anuradhpur significant?
questions.answer: It is believed to have grown from the branch brought by Sanghamitra.

questions.question: Which Sri Lankan goods were valued in India?
questions.answer: Sri Lankan pearls and precious stones were valued in India.

questions.question: Who constructed the caves at Sigiriya?
questions.answer: King Kashyap constructed the caves at Sigiriya.

questions.question: What is special about the Sigiriya cave paintings?
questions.answer: They resemble the paintings found in the Ajanta Caves.

questions.question: Which texts describe relations between India and Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Dipavamsa and Mahavamsa describe relations between India and Sri Lanka.

questions.question: In which language were Dipavamsa and Mahavamsa written?
questions.answer: They were written in the Pali language.

questions.question: Which Indian ruler sent an ambassador to China?
questions.answer: Emperor Harshavardhan sent an ambassador to China.

questions.question: What was Chinese silk called in ancient India?
questions.answer: Chinese silk was called Chinanshuka.

questions.question: Why was Chinese silk important in ancient trade?
questions.answer: Chinese silk was in great demand in India and western countries.

questions.question: What was the Silk Route used for?
questions.answer: The Silk Route was used for carrying out the silk trade by land.

questions.question: Name one Indian place connected to the Silk Route.
questions.answer: Nala-sopara near Mumbai was connected to the Silk Route.

questions.question: Which Chinese monks visited India through the Silk Route?
questions.answer: Fa Hien and Yuan Chwang visited India through the Silk Route.

questions.question: Which Chinese emperor invited Indian Buddhist monks?
questions.answer: The Ming Emperor invited Indian Buddhist monks.

questions.question: Name the monks who translated Buddhist texts into Chinese.
questions.answer: Dharmarakshaka and Kashyapmatanga translated Buddhist texts into Chinese.

questions.question: What was the result of translating Buddhist texts into Chinese?
questions.answer: It helped in the spread of Buddhism in China.

questions.question: Which countries adopted Buddhism after China?
questions.answer: Buddhism spread to Japan, Korea and Vietnam.

questions.question: Which ancient kingdom existed in Cambodia?
questions.answer: The ancient kingdom of Funan existed in Cambodia.

questions.question: Who is believed to have founded the kingdom of Funan?
questions.answer: An Indian named Kaundinya is believed to have founded Funan.

questions.question: Which language evidence proves Indian influence in Funan?
questions.answer: A Sanskrit stone inscription proves Indian influence in Funan.

questions.question: How did Indian-origin kingdoms help Southeast Asia?
questions.answer: They helped in spreading Indian culture in Southeast Asia.

questions.question: Which Indian epics influenced Southeast Asian art forms?
questions.answer: Ramayana and Mahabharata influenced Southeast Asian art forms.

questions.question: Where are Ramayana-based dance-dramas popular even today?
questions.answer: Ramayana-based dance-dramas are popular in Indonesia.

questions.question: Which religion spread to Myanmar and Thailand in ancient times?
questions.answer: Buddhism spread to Myanmar and Thailand in ancient times.

questions.question: Which Hindu deities’ temples were built later in Southeast Asia?
questions.answer: Temples of Lord Shiva and Vishnu were built later in Southeast Asia.

questions.question: Up to which century does the historical account in this chapter extend?
questions.answer: The historical account extends up to the eighth century CE.

questions.question: What is the next historical period mentioned after this chapter?
questions.answer: The next historical period mentioned is Medieval History.

questions.question: How did early trade relations influence India’s long-term connections with the western world?
questions.answer: Early trade relations laid the foundation for sustained economic and cultural exchanges between India and western countries.

questions.question: Why were trade routes crucial in strengthening India’s interaction with foreign civilizations?
questions.answer: Trade routes enabled regular movement of goods, ideas, and people, thereby strengthening India’s interaction with foreign civilizations.

questions.question: How did the curiosity of Greek historians shape western understanding of India?
questions.answer: Their writings provided information about India and introduced Indian society and culture to the western world.

questions.question: In what way did Greek artistic influence transform Indian sculpture?
questions.answer: Greek artistic influence led to realistic facial features and forms in Indian sculptures, especially in the Gandhara style.

questions.question: Why is the Gandhara school of art considered a result of cultural interaction?
questions.answer: It combined Indian religious themes with Greek sculptural techniques, showing cultural interaction between India and the west.

questions.question: How do archaeological findings support the existence of Indo-Roman trade?
questions.answer: Findings such as Roman-made bronze articles and coins at Indian sites confirm active trade between India and Rome.

questions.question: Why were ports in South India significant for international trade?
questions.answer: They served as major centers for maritime trade, connecting India with Rome and other foreign regions.

questions.question: How did Alexandria function as a link between India and Europe?
questions.answer: Alexandria acted as a transit port where Indian goods were collected and then sent onward to European countries.

questions.question: Why was the role of Arab merchants important in the spread of Indian knowledge?
questions.answer: Arab merchants not only traded goods but also transmitted Indian philosophy and scientific ideas to Europe.

questions.question: What makes the concept of zero a significant contribution of India to the world?
questions.answer: The concept of zero greatly advanced mathematics and was later introduced to Europe through Arab scholars.

questions.question: How did Ashoka’s mission to Sri Lanka strengthen cultural relations?
questions.answer: By spreading Buddhism through Mahendra and Sanghamitra, Ashoka strengthened religious and cultural ties with Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Why is Sanghamitra’s journey to Sri Lanka historically important?
questions.answer: Her journey symbolized the transmission of Buddhism and sacred traditions from India to Sri Lanka.

questions.question: How does the Bodhi tree tradition reflect religious continuity between India and Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: The belief that the Anuradhpur Bodhi tree grew from Sanghamitra’s branch reflects shared Buddhist heritage.

questions.question: Why were Sri Lankan pearls and precious stones important in Indo-Sri Lankan trade?
questions.answer: They were highly valued luxury items in India, encouraging active trade between the two regions.

questions.question: How do the Sigiriya cave paintings indicate artistic exchange?
questions.answer: Their resemblance to Ajanta paintings shows the influence of Indian art on Sri Lankan culture.

questions.question: Why are Dipavamsa and Mahavamsa important historical sources?
questions.answer: They provide written evidence of close religious and cultural relations between India and Sri Lanka.

questions.question: How did diplomatic exchanges enhance India-China relations?
questions.answer: Sending ambassadors, such as by Harshavardhan, strengthened political and cultural ties between India and China.

questions.question: Why was Chinese silk a key element of international trade involving India?
questions.answer: Its high demand made India an important intermediary in supplying silk to western countries.

questions.question: How did the Silk Route contribute to cultural exchange along with trade?
questions.answer: It allowed monks, traders, and ideas to travel across regions, promoting cultural and religious exchange.

questions.question: Why was Nala-sopara strategically important in ancient trade?
questions.answer: Its connection to the Silk Route made it a key link between inland trade routes and maritime commerce.

questions.question: How did visits by Chinese monks strengthen Buddhist ties with India?
questions.answer: Their travels helped exchange religious texts and practices, strengthening Buddhist links between India and China.

questions.question: Why was translation of Buddhist texts into Chinese a turning point?
questions.answer: It made Buddhist teachings accessible to the Chinese population, accelerating the spread of Buddhism.

questions.question: How did Buddhism spread beyond China to other East Asian countries?
questions.answer: Once established in China, Buddhist teachings spread further to Japan, Korea, and Vietnam.

questions.question: Why is the kingdom of Funan significant in Southeast Asian history?
questions.answer: It represents early Indian political and cultural influence in Southeast Asia.

questions.question: How does Sanskrit evidence confirm Indian cultural presence in Southeast Asia?
questions.answer: Sanskrit inscriptions show that Indian language and culture were adopted in Southeast Asian kingdoms.

questions.question: Why did Indian-origin kingdoms play a major role in cultural transmission?
questions.answer: They acted as centers for spreading Indian traditions, religion, and art in Southeast Asia.

questions.question: How did Indian epics influence Southeast Asian performing arts?
questions.answer: Stories from Ramayana and Mahabharata formed the basis of dance-dramas in countries like Indonesia.

questions.question: Why is the continued popularity of Indian epics in Southeast Asia significant?
questions.answer: It shows the lasting cultural impact of ancient Indian influence in the region.

questions.question: How did Buddhism contribute to shared cultural identity in Southeast Asia?
questions.answer: The spread of Buddhism created common religious beliefs among several Southeast Asian countries.

questions.question: Why were Hindu temples built in Southeast Asia in later periods?
questions.answer: They reflect the expansion of Indian religious influence beyond Buddhism in the region.

questions.question: How does this chapter show India as a cultural link between regions?
questions.answer: India connected the west, Central Asia, East Asia, and Southeast Asia through trade and culture.

questions.question: Why is trade considered a medium of cultural exchange in this chapter?
questions.answer: Trade enabled the movement of ideas, religion, art, and knowledge along with goods.

questions.question: How did religious missions strengthen India’s international influence?
questions.answer: They spread Indian religions and values, increasing India’s cultural influence abroad.

questions.question: Why is the study of ancient trade centers important for understanding history?
questions.answer: They reveal economic networks and cultural interactions of ancient civilizations.

questions.question: How does archaeological evidence complement written sources in this chapter?
questions.answer: Archaeological finds support written records by providing physical proof of trade and cultural exchange.

questions.question: Why did India maintain relations with both western and Asian countries?
questions.answer: Its geographical position and resources enabled India to interact with multiple regions.

questions.question: How did maritime and land routes together enhance India’s global connections?
questions.answer: They allowed India to trade by sea and land, expanding its reach to distant regions.

questions.question: Why is cultural influence considered long-lasting compared to political control?
questions.answer: Cultural practices continue through traditions even after political changes.

questions.question: How does the chapter highlight India’s role in the spread of knowledge?
questions.answer: It shows India transmitting philosophy, science, mathematics, and religion to other regions.

questions.question: Why is the concept of cultural exchange central to ancient history?
questions.answer: It explains how civilizations influenced one another beyond borders.

questions.question: How does the chapter demonstrate peaceful interaction between civilizations?
questions.answer: Most interactions occurred through trade, learning, and religion rather than conquest.

questions.question: Why are religious texts important for reconstructing ancient history?
questions.answer: They preserve historical events, beliefs, and interactions of the time.

questions.question: How did India’s cultural influence adapt to different regions?
questions.answer: Indian ideas blended with local traditions, creating region-specific cultural forms.

questions.question: Why is Southeast Asia an important region in understanding Indian cultural expansion?
questions.answer: It shows widespread and lasting Indian influence through religion, art, and language.

questions.question: How does the chapter connect economic activity with cultural development?
questions.answer: Economic trade created channels through which cultural and religious ideas spread.

questions.question: Why is the Silk Route described as more than a trade route?
questions.answer: It was also a pathway for cultural and religious exchange across continents.

questions.question: How does the chapter emphasize India’s contribution to world civilization?
questions.answer: It highlights India’s role in spreading religion, art, mathematics, and philosophy.

questions.question: Why is the eighth century CE a significant marker in this chapter?
questions.answer: It marks the end of the ancient historical period discussed in the chapter.

questions.question: How does this chapter prepare the reader for the study of medieval history?
questions.answer: It provides historical continuity up to the eighth century CE before medieval developments.

questions.question: What overall understanding does this chapter provide about ancient India’s global role?
questions.answer: It presents ancient India as an active center of trade, culture, and knowledge exchange.
